<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUDGET
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/11/states-manage-avoid-worstcase-budget-scenario?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Austin, We Don't Have a Problem
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last spring, forecasters warned of catastrophic budget shortfalls for US states, which needed to spend more on pandemic aid but would collect less tax revenue due to the surge in unemployment. Governors prepared to make painful cuts in critical services, including healthcare and education.   <br><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o6wNYW4Hqk6C1Uu1W/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That crisis hasn't fully materialized. And some states are in a much better financial position than they had anticipated eight months ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The evidence:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, Texas </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-11/texas-slashes-deficit-sees-stable-revenue-for-upcoming-budget?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated</a></span><span> that revenue for this budget cycle would come in just a hair lower than the last cycle. And it gave a buzzcut to its projected budget shortfall.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Despite everyone tweeting that they're leaving SF, California is "swimming in money," </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/gavin-newsom-california-coronavirus-pandemic-8d01e88ceeb4b0bc6cb1fb0d6a8d72b7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the AP</a></span><span>. Last Friday, it released its most expensive budget in history, complete with a $15 billion one-time surplus.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Optimistic revenue numbers from other states, including </span><span><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/bulletins/gd/MDCOMP-2b03519?wgt_ref=MDCOMP_WIDGET_C7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Maryland</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://www.minnpost.com/state-government/2020/12/minnesotas-budget-forecast-projects-641-million-surplus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Minnesota</a></span><span>, and </span><span><a href="https://www.courant.com/politics/hc-pol-connecticut-budget-deficit-improving-20201222-mponro5enrdchlgdjcmda4s6dq-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Connecticut</a></span><span>, showed that the worst-case scenario was averted. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What happened? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The K-shaped recovery</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While lower-income workers have suffered disproportionately during the pandemic, "Folks at the top are doing pretty damn well," said California Gov. Gavin Newsom.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In his state, residents pocketed a record $185 billion in capital gains income from asset sales...and $18.5 billion of that went to the government.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Texas, homeowners swarming Lowe's this summer supported sales tax revenues. Texas also benefited from a surge in e-commerce revenue thanks to a recent Supreme Court decision that allows states to collect sales tax from out-of-state retailers.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Federal stimulus in the form of added unemployment benefits and direct payments also helped shore up state budgets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, "better than expected" doesn't mean "good." In his State of the State address yesterday, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/11/nyregion/cuomo-state-coronavirus-budget.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emphasized</a> that, "Businesses have been lost, lifetime savings have been exhausted, personal debt has mounted." NY faces a $15 billion revenue shortfall this year, the largest in the state’s history. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/11/twitter-ban-germanys-chancellor-calls-trumps-suspension-problematic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's the Opposite of Schadenfreude?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="German Chancellor Angela Merkel sitting in front of a purple background during a media event. She is wearing a green suit jacket and colorful necklace. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjcxL2FuZ2VsYV9tZXJrZWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Omer Messinger via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a spokesperson for German Chancellor Angela Merkel <a href="https://apnews.com/article/merkel-trump-twitter-problematic-dc9732268493a8ac337e03159f0dc1c9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that Twitter's permanent suspension of President Trump is "problematic."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The reasoning: </strong></span><span>Free speech is a fundamental right, and while it's sometimes curtailed, that should only happen under legal guardrails set up by the government—not decisions by Big Tech CEOs who </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/09/technology/trump-twitter-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aren't publicly accountable</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire and Russian dissident Alexei Navalny voiced similar concerns about the precedent set by Twitter's action. And EU internal market commissioner Thierry Breton <a href="https://www.politico.eu/article/thierry-breton-social-media-capitol-hill-riot/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a>, "The fact that a CEO can pull the plug on POTUS's loudspeaker without any checks and balances is perplexing."</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Europe has its own ideas on tech regulation </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Merkel would like to see the US impose similar rules to Germany, which enacted pioneering internet regulation in 2018. Last month, the EU went even further, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/eu-unveils-regulations-targeting-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proposing</a> regulations to fine tech platforms up to 6% of annual revenue for failing to remove illegal content quickly. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Twitter's shares fell 6.4% yesterday. Investors <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-01-11/can-twitter-survive-banning-donald-trump?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are wondering</a> how the loss of the app's highest-profile user will affect future growth and profitability. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/11/businesses-suspend-tweak-political-giving?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Companies Do Something by Doing Nothing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of an illustrated pile of money that is slowing disappearing until nothing is left." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/u3syIIkCGV86djpGMA/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of an illustrated pile of money that is slowing disappearing until nothing is left." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/u3syIIkCGV86djpGMA/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following last week's attack on the Capitol, some of the biggest names in biz—JPMorgan, Blue Cross Blue Shield, and Marriott—<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/10/businesses-employees-reckon-fallout-capitol-riot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit pause</a> on political spending over the weekend. Not looking to get left behind...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Deloitte, T-Mobile, and Walmart </span><span><a href="https://popular.info/p/update-more-corporations-suspend?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are reassessing</a></span><span> their political spending strategies. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>3M, Coca-Cola, UPS, Microsoft, Facebook, Ford, and BlackRock </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-11/here-are-the-u-s-companies-hitting-pause-on-political-donations?srnd=markets-vp&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspended</a></span><span> all donations. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airbnb, AT&T, Amex, and Dow pulled support for 147 Republican lawmakers who voted against certifying Joe Biden's electoral college victory. Hallmark is even asking for its money back from Senators Josh Hawley and Roger Marshall.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Large corporations <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/11/business/dealbook/corporate-political-donations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regularly donate</a> to politicians of both parties through political action committees (PACs), often funded by employees, but now they want some distance from the fracas on the Hill. While PAC donations are publicly disclosed, businesses could theoretically continue with more discrete giving to "dark money" groups that don’t disclose donors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>because we're in the quarter after a major election cycle, less money is at stake. But if businesses stick to their bans on certain politicians or reduce future spending, it could ding fundraising heading into the 2022 midterms. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s called a visual metaphor (or simile, not sure tbh). And it represents what <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210136&psource=esamnbwdg0210136&wsource=esamnbwdg0210136" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a> can help you do with your stock portfolio.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They’ve got the expertise and stock picks that can help you potentially build your portfolio into a taller and taller block structure. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For example, they’ve just placed a new <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210136&psource=esamnbwdg0210136&wsource=esamnbwdg0210136" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">“All In” stock buy alert</a> for a company that could be a big tech player before you can say “look at the arrows on those blocks.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The stock is 1/50th the size of Google, yet it stands to profit as more and more people turn to streaming TV.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over 750,000 investors trust <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210136&psource=esamnbwdg0210136&wsource=esamnbwdg0210136" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a>, and when you sign up for their Stock Advisor service, you can learn about this potentially huge stock (and many more).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210136&psource=esamnbwdg0210136&wsource=esamnbwdg0210136" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Start building your portfolio and sign up today</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/11/privacyfocused-messaging-social-media-apps-growing-popularity?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We're Past the Days of 'Angry Birds' and 'Temple Run'
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="App Store free apps" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjc1L2FwcF9zdG9yZV9mcmVlX2FwcHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>iPhone screenshots</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Encrypted messaging platforms Signal and Telegram have shot to the top of the App Store's free app charts, reflecting the <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/11/following-riots-alternative-social-apps-and-private-messengers-top-the-app-stores/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">growing use</a> of privacy-focused apps after Big Tech's mass-deplatforming of President Trump.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A little celeb endorsement helps: </strong>Both Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Tesla CEO Elon Musk gave Signal <a href="https://www.cnet.com/how-to/elon-musk-wants-you-to-use-signal-instead-of-facebook-heres-what-to-know-about-the-app/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some love</a> on Twitter, leading to 325,000 new installs since Thursday. Signal's end-to-end encryption and policy against collecting user data make it a popular option for users who prioritize privacy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> A scroll through the free app charts reveals a number of other unfamiliar social media apps. The rise of social networks that tout "free speech," like MeWe and CloutHub, directly coincides with Apple banning Parler, an indicator that the app's largely conservative user base is looking for a new home. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Parler <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/11/parler-sues-amazon-leveling-far-fetched-antitrust-allegations/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued Amazon</a> on antitrust grounds after Amazon pulled its web hosting services for the app.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/11/onerepublics-ryan-tedder-sells-rights-music-catalog-200m-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Songbird of Our Generation Secures the Bag
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ryan Tedder singing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjY5L3J5YW5fdGVkZGVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Venla Shalin/Redferns</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What do "Halo"<em> </em>by<em> </em>Beyoncé, "Rumor Has It"<em> </em>by Adele, and "Sucker" by the Jonas Brothers all have in common? 1) They were played way too much on the radio and 2) OneRepublic frontman Ryan Tedder wrote them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, private equity firm KKR <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kkr-buys-into-producer-ryan-tedders-music-catalog-11610364781?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought a majority stake</a> in Tedder's impressive songwriting catalog in a deal that values the 500+ songs at around $200 million, per the WSJ. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Counting stars...and dollars </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tedder's haul is the latest eye-popping deal in a wave of musical copyright transactions that have already popped lots of eyes. Last month, Bob Dylan <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/bob-dylan-sells-songwriting-catalog-universal-music-publishing-group-historic-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold the rights</a> to his catalog for over $300 million, and Fleetwood Mac's Stevie Nicks pulled in $80 million for the rights to 80% of her catalog. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why the hefty price tags? As streaming becomes more dominant, the long-term value of hit songs is only increasing.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>For many musicians, their decision to sell came down to one factor—the pandemic. With touring on hold, Tedder and others opted to cash a ticket while the market is frothy. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

</a>
</td>
</tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Corporations Aren’t People, but People Might Be Corporations
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide/stories/2021/01/11/gig-economy-taxes-need-uberaccountants-app" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tax illustration" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjc0L3RheF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Wang</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least when it comes to the surging gig economy. The share of gig workers at US businesses jumped 15% from 2010 to 2020, according to ADP, and the pandemic only pushed more American workers to go solo when they lost jobs or earnings.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While being your own boss is fun to brag about on distanced first dates, tax season is a different story. Freelancers have to operate as independent businesses, and figuring out what to send the IRS’s way can be so confusing even the <em>Westworld</em> creators would say, “now that just seems way too convoluted.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We’re here to help: </strong>With tax season on its way, Morning Brew will be rolling out a new series to make sure you're prepared for this unconventional filing season.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first piece, a high-level overview of the growth of the gig economy, just dropped. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide/stories/2021/01/11/gig-economy-taxes-need-uberaccountants-app?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<td style="padding: 15px;">

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

The offer is $2.1 billion.  </span>

Mark Cuban \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/mcuban/status/1348663730712834056?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eweighed in\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Twitter yesterday: \"Watching the cryptos trade, it's EXACTLY like the internet stock bubble...along the way MANY fortunes will be made and LOST and we find out who has the stomach to HODL and who doesn't.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nBUDGET \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/11/states-manage-avoid-worstcase-budget-scenario?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAustin, We Don't Have a Problem\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast spring, forecasters warned of catastrophic budget shortfalls for US states, which needed to spend more on pandemic aid but would collect less tax revenue due to the surge in unemployment. Governors prepared to make painful cuts in critical services, including healthcare and education.   \u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/3o6wNYW4Hqk6C1Uu1W/giphy.gif\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat crisis hasn't fully materialized. And some states are in a much better financial position than they had anticipated eight months ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe evidence:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Texas \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-11/texas-slashes-deficit-sees-stable-revenue-for-upcoming-budget?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that revenue for this budget cycle would come in just a hair lower than the last cycle. And it gave a buzzcut to its projected budget shortfall.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDespite everyone tweeting that they're leaving SF, California is \"swimming in money,\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/gavin-newsom-california-coronavirus-pandemic-8d01e88ceeb4b0bc6cb1fb0d6a8d72b7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the AP\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Last Friday, it released its most expensive budget in history, complete with a $15 billion one-time surplus.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOptimistic revenue numbers from other states, including \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://content.govdelivery.com/bulletins/gd/MDCOMP-2b03519?wgt_ref=MDCOMP_WIDGET_C7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMaryland\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.minnpost.com/state-government/2020/12/minnesotas-budget-forecast-projects-641-million-surplus/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMinnesota\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.courant.com/politics/hc-pol-connecticut-budget-deficit-improving-20201222-mponro5enrdchlgdjcmda4s6dq-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eConnecticut\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, showed that the worst-case scenario was averted. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe K-shaped recovery\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile lower-income workers have suffered disproportionately during the pandemic, \"Folks at the top are doing pretty damn well,\" said California Gov. Gavin Newsom.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn his state, residents pocketed a record $185 billion in capital gains income from asset sales...and $18.5 billion of that went to the government.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Texas, homeowners swarming Lowe's this summer supported sales tax revenues. Texas also benefited from a surge in e-commerce revenue thanks to a recent Supreme Court decision that allows states to collect sales tax from out-of-state retailers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFederal stimulus in the form of added unemployment benefits and direct payments also helped shore up state budgets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, \"better than expected\" doesn't mean \"good.\" In his State of the State address yesterday, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/11/nyregion/cuomo-state-coronavirus-budget.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemphasized\u003c/a\u003e that, \"Businesses have been lost, lifetime savings have been exhausted, personal debt has mounted.\" NY faces a $15 billion revenue shortfall this year, the largest in the state’s history. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjcxL2FuZ2VsYV9tZXJrZWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eOmer Messinger via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, a spokesperson for German Chancellor Angela Merkel \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/merkel-trump-twitter-problematic-dc9732268493a8ac337e03159f0dc1c9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that Twitter's permanent suspension of President Trump is \"problematic.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reasoning: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFree speech is a fundamental right, and while it's sometimes curtailed, that should only happen under legal guardrails set up by the government—not decisions by Big Tech CEOs who \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/09/technology/trump-twitter-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earen't publicly accountable\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrench Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire and Russian dissident Alexei Navalny voiced similar concerns about the precedent set by Twitter's action. And EU internal market commissioner Thierry Breton \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.eu/article/thierry-breton-social-media-capitol-hill-riot/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e, \"The fact that a CEO can pull the plug on POTUS's loudspeaker without any checks and balances is perplexing.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eEurope has its own ideas on tech regulation \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMerkel would like to see the US impose similar rules to Germany, which enacted pioneering internet regulation in 2018. Last month, the EU went even further, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/eu-unveils-regulations-targeting-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproposing\u003c/a\u003e regulations to fine tech platforms up to 6% of annual revenue for failing to remove illegal content quickly. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTwitter's shares fell 6.4% yesterday. Investors \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-01-11/can-twitter-survive-banning-donald-trump?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare wondering\u003c/a\u003e how the loss of the app's highest-profile user will affect future growth and width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing last week's attack on the Capitol, some of the biggest names in biz—JPMorgan, Blue Cross Blue Shield, and Marriott—\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/10/businesses-employees-reckon-fallout-capitol-riot?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit pause\u003c/a\u003e on political spending over the weekend. Not looking to get left behind...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDeloitte, T-Mobile, and Walmart \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://popular.info/p/update-more-corporations-suspend?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare reassessing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e their political spending strategies. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e3M, Coca-Cola, UPS, Microsoft, Facebook, Ford, and BlackRock \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-11/here-are-the-u-s-companies-hitting-pause-on-political-donations?srnd=markets-vp\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspended\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e all donations. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirbnb, AT\u0026T, Amex, and Dow pulled support for 147 Republican lawmakers who voted against certifying Joe Biden's electoral college victory. Hallmark is even asking for its money back from Senators Josh Hawley and Roger Marshall.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Large corporations \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/11/business/dealbook/corporate-political-donations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eregularly donate\u003c/a\u003e to politicians of both parties through political action committees (PACs), often funded by employees, but now they want some distance from the fracas on the Hill. While PAC donations are publicly disclosed, businesses could theoretically continue with more discrete giving to \"dark money\" groups that don’t disclose donors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ebecause we're in the quarter after a major election cycle, less money is at stake. But if businesses stick to their bans on certain politicians or reduce future spending, it could ding fundraising heading into the 2022 midterms. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat do \"Halo\"\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eby\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eBeyoncé, \"Rumor Has It\"\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eby Adele, and \"Sucker\" by the Jonas Brothers all have in common? 1) They were played way too much on the radio and 2) OneRepublic frontman Ryan Tedder wrote them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, private equity firm KKR \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/kkr-buys-into-producer-ryan-tedders-music-catalog-11610364781?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebought a majority stake\u003c/a\u003e in Tedder's impressive songwriting catalog in a deal that values the 500+ songs at around $200 million, per the WSJ. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCounting stars...and dollars \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTedder's haul is the latest eye-popping deal in a wave of musical copyright transactions that have already popped lots of eyes. Last month, Bob Dylan \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/bob-dylan-sells-songwriting-catalog-universal-music-publishing-group-historic-deal?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold the rights\u003c/a\u003e to his catalog for over $300 million, and Fleetwood Mac's Stevie Nicks pulled in $80 million for the rights to 80% of her catalog. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhy the hefty price tags? As streaming becomes more dominant, the long-term value of hit songs is only increasing.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFor many musicians, their decision to sell came down to one factor—the pandemic.
